body_html:
Just execute below code and you will understand that both of the below lines create variables under different name. v1:0, v1_1:0(Which may be a bug!). Just use get_variable everywhere with different reuse property, that should work!

v1 = tf.Variable([1], name="v1", dtype=tf.float32)
v2 = tf.get_variable("v1", [1], dtype=tf.float32)
body_text:
Just execute below code and you will understand that both of the below lines create variables under different name. v1:0, v1_1:0(Which may be a bug!). Just use get_variable everywhere with different reuse property, that should work!
v1 = tf.Variable([1], name="v1", dtype=tf.float32)
v2 = tf.get_variable("v1", [1], dtype=tf.float32)
body:
Just execute below code and you will understand that both of the below lines create variables under different name. v1:0, v1_1:0(Which may be a bug!). Just use get_variable everywhere with different reuse property, that should work!

v1 = tf.Variable([1], name="v1", dtype=tf.float32)
v2 = tf.get_variable("v1", [1], dtype=tf.float32)
